newsitem.title: USA: INSCI sees "significant" loss in Q1.
newsitem.headline: INSCI sees "significant" loss in Q1.

text.p: Computer software company INSCI Corp said on Monday that it would incur a significant loss for its fiscal first quarter ended June 30, with revenues for the quarter coming in under the $2.9 million reported for the year-ago period.

"We spent considerable time during the quarter supporting our indirect sales channel and training them on the six new products that we recently launched," said company president Dr. E. Ted Prince. "The training time meant less selling time overall, and more time spent on expanding channels rather than completing single sales," he added.
